page.title: 16OUR SCHOOL TRIP 1985
page.content: On July 11th, we went on a class trip to Pickering.When we reached Pickering we split up into two groups. 15 of the older pupils went with Mr Nettleship to a Museum at Hutton Le Hole.The museum was full of interesting objects which showed what it was like to live in a country village about 100 years ago.After that,the group went up to the forest.Some went pony trekking there whilst the better riders went on to ride in Pickering.While all this was going on,the other children were travelling by train from Pickering to Grosmont.After eating their lunch and having a paddle in a stream,the children had a look around Grosmont. The return trip to Pickering was on a steam train.At 2.30 the groups met together again to drive by coach to Scarboro'.All the pupils went to the Swimming Pool then we went home.
